questions.question: It ………………………. not take me more than 10 minutes to get ready.
questions.description: Use does with it. Has is used with the past participle forms of the verb.

questions.question: ……………………… leave now.
questions.description: In the simple present tense we make negatives and questions with do and does.

questions.question: ………………………… at once.
questions.description: The simple present is used in imperative sentences.

questions.question: When I was young I …………………….. walk 10 miles in an hour.
questions.description: Use could to talk about past ability.

questions.question: They ………………………… live in a caravan.
questions.description: Would cannot refer to past states only used to can refer to past states.

questions.question: The old woman ………………………… spend hours talking to herself.
questions.description: Would and used to can both be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: Once upon a time, there ………………………. a pretty girl.
questions.description: Use past tenses in story telling.

questions.question: They gave ………………………. without any resistance.
questions.description: To give in is to surrender.

questions.question: A powerful earthquake ……………………….. the city yesterday.
questions.description: Use the simple past to say when something happened.

questions.question: I ………………………. them before.
questions.description: The present perfect is more common with before.

questions.question: I didn’t realize that I ……………………… a mistake.
questions.description: When the main verb is the past tense, use a past tense in the subordinate clause as well.
